p: Three of the five GAS outbreaks provided antibiotic prophylaxis to the residents and staff [ 17, 24, 37]. All five studies conducted surveillance culture for active case finding. None of the five outbreaks reported droplet precautions, but the study by Thigpen et al. [ 24] mentioned an enhanced respiratory hygiene practice. Although three of the GAS outbreaks lasted for a long period due to an unsolved person-to-person transmission [ 17, 20, 37], none of the studies implemented social distancing measures. Two studies improved the availability of hand dispensers to address the suboptimal hand hygiene practice that was revealed during their observation [ 17, 24]. None of the studies on the three outbreaks involving sick employees reported encouragement of work exclusion for ill staff [ 20, 37, 38], but some studies reported that there were voluntary sick leaves of employees before the recognition of the outbreaks.
